content:
Yes, there are a few ways to print or share responses without printing multiple pages:

1. Copy and paste the text into a document or email: Simply highlight the text of the response, right-click and select "Copy", then open a document or email and right-click and select "Paste" to insert the text. You can then print or share the document or email as needed.
2. Use a "Print to PDF" feature: Many modern web browsers have a "Print to PDF" feature that allows you to save a webpage or document as a PDF file. Simply open the page with the response you want to save, click "Print" and select "Save as PDF" as the destination. You can then save or share the PDF file as needed.
3. Use a web clipping tool: There are various web clipping tools available, such as Evernote or OneNote, that allow you to clip and save webpages or specific sections of a webpage. Simply install the tool, clip the section of the response you want to save, and then save or share the clip as needed.

I hope these options are helpful!
